title: Paisiello - Il Mondo della Luna - Opera
description:
Il Mondo della Luna
Commedia per musica

Composer:  Giovanni Paisiello (1740 - 1816)
Librettist:   Carlo Osvoldo Goldoni (1707 - 1793)
Genre:  Classical Comic Opera
Language:  Italian
First performance:  1782, KammenÃƒÂ¯y Ostrov, St. Petersburg, Russia

Ensemble:  Orchestra Dei Giovani del Conservatorio "Claudio Monteverdi" di Bolzano
Conductor:  Fabio Neri
Chorus:  Coro Dell&#039; Associazione Musica e Canto Corale
Chorus Master:  Livia Bertagnolli

Recorded:  August 4 - 6, 1993, La Casa de la Cultura de Bolzano, Italy

Performers:
Carla Di Censo (Soprano - Flaminia)
Enzo Dara (Bass - Buonafede)
Gemma Bertagnolli (Soprano - Clarice)
Daniele Gaspari (Tenor - Ecclittico)
Mattia Nicolini (Bass - Ernesto)
Riccardo Ristori (Tenor - Cecco)

Label:  Bongiovanni
Total time:  84:17
Rip:  mp3 @ 320 kbps

"Paisiello was one of the most successful and influential opera composers of his time. Most of his over 80 operas are comic and use a simple, direct and spirited style, latterly with sharper characterization, more colorful scoring and warmer melodies (features that influenced Mozart). His serious operas have less than the conventional amount of virtuoso vocal writing; those for Russia are the closest to Gluck&#039;s &#039;reform&#039; approach."  - Grove Concise Dictionary of Music

Please help seed so that others may enjoy this music as well.
